item.title: First Look Sherco 300i
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
Here it is, the much awaited new Sherco. I have just been cleaning up after the first short ride. There will be plenty more riding to follow shortly. Look for a first ride review next week. I have to say, it sure is pretty, kind of like a Gas Gas and KTM had a baby.
Related posts:

item.content:encoded:

Here it is, the much awaited new Sherco. I have just been cleaning up after the first short ride. There will be plenty more riding to follow shortly. Look for a first ride review next week. I have to say, it sure is pretty, kind of like a Gas Gas and KTM had a baby.

item.title: Team USA ISDE Riders Announced
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
The American Motorcyclist Association is pleased to announce the U.S. riders who will contest the 88th International Six Days Enduro. Led by the World Trophy Team of Mike Brown, Kurt Caselli, Thad Duvall, Charlie Mullins, Zach Osborne and Taylor Robert, a contingent of 31 U.S. riders will face the best off-road racers in the world [...]
Related posts:
  1. 2012 USA Six Day Team Announced
  2. 2011 Finland ISDE Team USA
  3. AMA Announces ISDE Qualifier Schedule
item.content:encoded:
The American Motorcyclist Association is pleased to announce the U.S. riders who will contest the 88th International Six Days Enduro. Led by the World Trophy Team of Mike Brown, Kurt Caselli, Thad Duvall, Charlie Mullins, Zach Osborne and Taylor Robert, a contingent of 31 U.S. riders will face the best off-road racers in the world in Sardinia, Italy, Sept. 30-Oct. 5.

“We are honored to once again contest the ISDE and chase the American dream of winning this prestigious event,” said AMA Off-Road Manager Chuck Weir. “We are excited about our entire team for 2013, not just the World Trophy Team but all the American riders. We fully expect to achieve our goal of a team world championship at the ISDE this September.”

Antti Kallonen, who guides KTM’s off-road racing teams in North American competition, manages the U.S. ISDE team.

“We made great progress last year with our ISDE program, and I’m happy to see that we have been able to build an even better team and program for this year,” Kallonen said. “Our Trophy team is as good as it can be, and all team riders are already hard at work to make sure we are 100 percent prepared.”

“It’s fulfilling that our efforts have caught motocross riders’ and teams’ attention,” he added. “There are a bunch of great off-road riders in the motocross world, and I’m glad to have Zach Osborne teaming up in the Trophy Team alongside our solid off-road riders.”

Caselli, from Palmdale, Calif., will captain the World Trophy Team. He will race a KTM in Italy. Brown, from Bluff City, Tenn., and Mullins, from Hickory, N.C., will also be on KTMs. Osborne, from Abingdon, Va., and Duvall, from Williamstown, W.Va., will race Hondas. Robert, from Scottsdale, Ariz., will ride a Kawasaki.

“It’s great to be on the AMA’s World Trophy Team again for this years’ ISDE in Sardinia,” Caselli said. “We’re bringing the best off-road riders that the United States has to offer with a great chance of winning the World Trophy.”

Like ISDE veteran Brown, who won the 2001 125cc AMA National Motocross Championship before his career shifted to off-road racing, Osborne’s roots are in motocross. However, the 23-year-old — a newcomer to the ISDE — has been branching into off-road recently and says he is ready for the competition at the ISDE.

“I’m very excited about this opportunity,” Osborne said. “I know it will be a challenge for me, but I’m working hard to be prepared and do my best for the team. I have to give a big thanks to everyone involved in picking me, and also my team for supporting me and giving me a bike to race.”

The World Trophy Team is one of three premier teams that represent the United States at the ISDE. The others are the Junior Trophy Team, which fields four riders younger than 23 years old, and the Women’s Trophy Team, which fields three female riders. In addition, several club team members represent the United States at the event.

The U.S. Junior Trophy Team will include Grant Baylor from Belton, S.C.; Steward Baylor from Belton, S.C.; Andrew DeLong from Morgantown, Pa.; and Jesse Groemm from Forked River, N.J. Grant and Steward Baylor are brothers, and both will ride KTMs. DeLong will ride a Husqvarna, and Groemm will compete on a Yamaha.

The U.S. Women’s Cup Team will include Rachel Gutish from Terre Haute, Ind.; Mandi Mastin from Whitehouse, Ohio; and Brooke Hodges from San Martin, Calif. All three Women’s Cup Team riders will field KTMs in Italy.

The U.S. ISDE team has also designated a Senior Club Team of veterans from the club team members. This year, the Senior Club Team will include Team JAFMAR riders Scott Bright from Platteville, Colo.; Jeff Fredette from Beecher, Ill.; and Brian T. Storrie from Denton, Texas.

The Wellard Team will represent one of the strongest club teams this year. It will include national-caliber riders Nick Fahringer from Dayton, Ohio, on a Husaberg; Jimmy Jarrett from Salem, Ohio, on a Kawasaki; and Ryan Sipes, from Flaherty, Ky., on a Suzuki.

Other teams include team GoFasters.com (Johnny Barner, Ian Blythe and Alex Dorsey); AMA District 37 (Sam Buffa, Trevor Kline and Ryan Kudla); team Tony Agonis (Keith Curtis, Fred Hoess and Josh Knight); and Dewitt Powersports (Jeff O’Leary, Shawn O’Leary and Cory Pincock).

Riders at the ISDE compete in one of three displacement classes: the E1 class, which features 100cc to 125cc two-stroke and 175cc to 250cc four-stroke motorcycles; the E2 class, which features 175cc to 250cc two-stroke and 290cc to 450cc four-stroke motorcycles; and the E3 class, which features 290cc to 500cc two-stroke and 475cc to 650cc four-stroke motorcycles.

The AMA’s ISDE effort would be impossible without the significant support of numerous companies. In addition to riders’ individual manufacturer and product sponsors, direct team sponsors include Wellard, Arai, Worldwide Material Handling Products, Spectro, Motion Pro, Radiant Global Logistics and Moose Racing.

America’s motorcyclists can help support the U.S. ISDE team, and look good while doing it, by purchasing an official U.S. ISDE T-Shirt. All proceeds support the effort to transport the riders, bikes and crew to and from Italy. To buy a shirt, and to get more information about the U.S. ISDE effort, visitwww.americanmotorcyclist.com/racing/internationalcompetition/isde.

 

Mike Garvin sent us some photos from the Idaho City Qualifier

Related posts:

  1. 2012 USA Six Day Team Announced
  2. 2011 Finland ISDE Team USA
  3. AMA Announces ISDE Qualifier Schedule

item.title: HRC Honda Ready For Desafio Ruta
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
Team HRC is all set for the fourth round of the FIM Cross Country Rally World Championship – the Desafio Ruta 40, which will be held in Argentina from 17-22 June. The 2013 edition of the Desafio Ruta 40 heads out from San Salvador de Jujuy and will finish in San Juan some 3500km (2200 [...]
Related posts:
  1. Helder Rodrigues – The New Honda Man
  2. Team HRC Announces 2014 Dakar Line Up
  3. 2012 Desafio Litoral Day 2 Results
item.content:encoded:
Team HRC is all set for the fourth round of the FIM Cross Country Rally World Championship – the Desafio Ruta 40, which will be held in Argentina from 17-22 June.

The 2013 edition of the Desafio Ruta 40 heads out from San Salvador de Jujuy and will finish in San Juan some 3500km (2200 miles) and 2000km of special test later, after a total of six days of racing.

As one of South America’s best-known and best-loved races, it is equally popular with all the top international rally riders, thanks to its range of varied terrain as well as for being the closest thing in the Cross Country Rally FIM calendar to what can be expected in the next Dakar 2014.

This will be an important test for Team HRC to see how well the riders are shaping up and bonding together, as well as being a great test-bench to fine-tune some of the technical modifications of the Honda CRF450 Rally machine.

The bike, still in its 2013 version, will be ridden by Portuguese Helder Rodrigues and local Argentine hero Javier Pizzolito.

Monday 17 June sees the first 540km stage, with 371km of special test, taking the competitors from San Salvador de Jujuy to San Miguel de Tucuman. 

Helder Rodrigues #3:

I want to put in a good race as I wasn’t really happy with the last two in Abu Dhabi and Sardinia. I’ll do my best. It’ll also be important to familiarize myself with the kind of terrain that we’ll come up against in the next Dakar.

Javier Pizzolito #7:

This race will help me improve my riding on rocky terrain, and will serve to build a rapport with my team-mate Helder in the run-up to the Dakar ‘14. Ruta 40 also forms a part of the Argentinian national championship, which I am currently leading, so I’ve got to get a result.

Martino Bianchi – General Manager Team HRC Rally:

The Desafio Ruta 40 is particularly important for the team and riders in such a strategic moment of the season. It’ll be the last race on terrain similar to that of the Dakar, so it will give us the chance to test some of the new technical features of the bike, and see how our riders are shaping up for the event.

Related posts:

  1. Helder Rodrigues – The New Honda Man
  2. Team HRC Announces 2014 Dakar Line Up
  3. 2012 Desafio Litoral Day 2 Results

item.title: Chris Denison Erzberg Footage
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
Dirt Rider has posted some GoPro footage of Chris Denison’s Erzberg race. Usually I tend to stay away from posting things that are from other sites, but this is just too good to miss. As you will see, Chris had plenty of challenges to face in Austria. It even includes a scene with a rider [...]
Related posts:
  1. 2012 Erzberg Final Results
  2. Snowing At Erzberg
  3. KTM’s Chris Birch Finishes 2nd at Romaniacs
item.content:encoded:
Dirt Rider has posted some GoPro footage of Chris Denison’s Erzberg race. Usually I tend to stay away from posting things that are from other sites, but this is just too good to miss. As you will see, Chris had plenty of challenges to face in Austria. It even includes a scene with a rider going over the “cliff” that we posted earlier.

I am completely in awe of the riders at Erzberg. It is such a crazy event, especially considering that the vast majority of the riders will never make the finish, roughly only 1 in 100. Chris started nearly deal last, made 6 checks and finished 139th . Considering that over 1,500 riders showed up to try and get in the race, it is a very respectable finish.

http://www.dirtrider.com/features/2013-erzberg-rodeo-gopro-footage/

Related posts:

  1. 2012 Erzberg Final Results
  2. Snowing At Erzberg
  3. KTM’s Chris Birch Finishes 2nd at Romaniacs

item.title: Colton Haaker & Johnny Campbell For Last Dog Standing
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
It’s that time of year again when the Prairie Dog MC’s take over Glen Helen, CA to build the Last Dog Standing course. This coming Saturday, June 15th, the 3rd annual Prairie Dogs Last Dog Standing is set to make its way into the record books. This race is one of, if not the most [...]
Related posts:
  1. 2012 Last Dog Standing Results
  2. 2012 Last Dog Standing News
  3. Johnny Campbell To Race 2013 Dakar
item.content:encoded:
It’s that time of year again when the Prairie Dog MC’s take over Glen Helen, CA to build the Last Dog Standing course. This coming Saturday, June 15th, the 3rd annual Prairie Dogs Last Dog Standing is set to make its way into the record books. This race is one of, if not the most difficult races in America.

More info with videos from last years grueling event is available from the Prairie Dog’s website. http://www.prairiedogsmc.com/html/last_dog_standing_2013.html

You can also check out the Last Dog Standing Facebook page

“This race is not for the faint of heart. A true spectacle of motorsports that my family and I look forward to every year. It is a great atmosphere and one of those events that you just have to see to believe. I am hoping to do better than I did last year when myself and Chris Dennison had to carry my bike across the finish line of LD2 and I’m excited to see Colton Haaker give it a go.” — Johnny Campbell

Related posts:

  1. 2012 Last Dog Standing Results
  2. 2012 Last Dog Standing News
  3. Johnny Campbell To Race 2013 Dakar

item.title: New 2014 Yamaha YZ250f & YZ450f
item.dc:creator: Chilly
item.description:
All New Yamaha YZ Models For 2014 So what does everyone think of the new YZ’s? I have to admit, when I heard that the 450 would be redesigned for 2014, I just automatically assumed that the reverse engine design would be dropped and Yamaha would return to a conventional design. So I was a [...]
Related posts:
  1. 2014 Husaberg Models – First Look
  2. 2014 KTM 350exc Six Days Model
  3. 2014 KTM 350 EXC
item.content:encoded:
All New Yamaha YZ Models For 2014

So what does everyone think of the new YZ’s? I have to admit, when I heard that the 450 would be redesigned for 2014, I just automatically assumed that the reverse engine design would be dropped and Yamaha would return to a conventional design. So I was a bit surprised to see that both new models follow the same pattern. It will be very interested to see how the two are received by the press.

Yamaha has been conspicuously absent from most race podiums anywhere in the world, both in moto and enduro. Am-Pro’s Paul Whibley has been just about the only racer in the world to see consistent top results. Although curiously enough, the Yamaha France Dakar bike has also looked very competitive. This will be Cyril Despres new ride for the Dakar Rally.

2014 YZ250f Features

  • New liquid-cooled, DOHC 4-valve, fuel-injected engine with the same forward-positioned, straight intake, rear-inclined cylinder, and rear-positioned exhaust layout as the YZ450F. This new engine has more power than the ’13 YZ250F, especially in the mid-to-high rpm range.
  • The 4-titanium-valve cylinder head is matched to a new fuel injection system that provides more power at mid-to-high rpm. The fuel injection system instantly adjusts the air/fuel mixtures depending on altitude and temperature, for a hesitation-free engine that delivers no matter the conditions.
  • The new aluminum Bilateral Beam frame offers a superb rigidity balance and, with new front and rear suspension components and settings, provides unmatched lightweight handling. Even fans of the previous YZ250F will be sure to notice the solid handling characteristics, including the light feel in tight corners and during direction changes.
  • The exhaust pipe has an innovative layout, circling the cylinder, giving the exhaust pipe proper length for an excellent exhaust pulse effect. At the same time, the exhaust pipe has three different diameters throughout the exhaust tract, bringing out excellent power characteristics. This new layout allows the silencer to be positioned 190mm further forward, behind the side panel, making it closer to the middle of the bike for centralized mass for superior handling.
  • The all-new layout of the seat, fuel tank, air box, and wrap-around exhaust system moves the bike’s mass towards the center for exceptional handling. And, in addition to an all-new appearance, the front intake layout with larger air filter element adds the benefit of reduced air filter maintenance due to its positioning away from dirt roost from the rear wheel.
  • Accessory GYTR® Power Tuner lets owners adjust air/fuel mixture and ignition timing maps to match engine performance characteristics to the rider and track conditions in a matter of seconds with the push of a few buttons.

Related posts:

  1. 2014 Husaberg Models – First Look
  2. 2014 KTM 350exc Six Days Model
  3. 2014 KTM 350 EXC
